item.title: 来自雅卡玛族的语言学家弗吉尼亚-贝弗特（Virginia Beavert）与他人合作编写了第一本萨哈普廷语词典，并建立了教授这种传统上没有文字记载的语言的基础设施。
item.description:
A linguist from the Yakama Nation, Virginia Beavert co-wrote the first Sahaptin dictionary and built the infrastructure to teach a language that wasn’t traditionally written down https://t.co/1UfhKhaIRy https://t.co/1UfhKhaIRy

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 为什么没有更多的东西像汽车一样需要召回？专栏作家乔-奎纳（Joe Queenan）提出了一些候选方案，比如他外套上的故障拉链和最后一部《夺宝奇兵》电影
item.description:

item.title: 尽管美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）的气候规则遭到了广泛反对，但经过一些最终修改后，有一个群体似乎得到了大部分安抚：中小企业

item.title: 大韩航空（Korean Air Lines）表示，将与空中客车公司（Airbus）签订一份价值 137 亿美元的合同，采购 33 架喷气式飞机，以加强其长途机队，同时逐步淘汰老旧飞机。
item.description:
Korean Air Lines said it would sign a contract with Airbus to procure 33 jets in a deal valued at $13.7 billion, as the airline seeks to strengthen its long-haul fleet while it gradually retires older aircraft https://t.co/TEoh14GoOd https://t.co/TEoh14GoOd

item.title: 知道我们离改写古老的历史总是差一个发现，这让人感到谦卑。这也令人振奋，@阿曼达-福尔曼博士写道
item.description:

item.title: 密西西比河港口小镇纳奇斯可能不在您的必游清单上。但是，对于那些追求美食、友好的人们以及对历史的冷静和不加修饰的审视的人来说，它应该是必到之地。
item.description:
Natchez, a small Mississippi River port town, may not be on your must-travel list. But for anyone after good food, friendly people and a sober, unglorified look at history, it should be. https://t.co/EXmpLWXmi0 https://t.co/EXmpLWXmi0

item.title: 他说，他这样做是为了拯救以色列，因为他担心以色列正在失去美国的支持。"如果以色列成为一个遭人唾弃的国家，我不知道它能否生存下去"。
item.description:
I sat down with ⁦@SenSchumer⁩ to find out why he denounced @netanyahu⁩ in a high-stakes speech

He said he did it to save Israel, which he fears is losing support in America

“If Israel becomes a pariah state, I don’t know if it can survive” https://t.co/NXzn0MZJjv

— Lindsay Wise (@lindsaywise) March 21, 2024

item.title: 联邦贸易委员会称，在大流行病期间，大型食品杂货连锁店利用其规模优势保持货架上的存货，在大多数商店面临产品短缺和配送瓶颈的情况下击败了小型竞争对手。
item.description:
The FTC said large grocery chains used their scale to keep shelves stocked during the pandemic, edging out smaller rivals when most stores struggled with product shortages and distribution bottlenecks https://t.co/RyJKZyyTaf https://t.co/RyJKZyyTaf

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024

item.title: 现在可以通过皮肤活检来诊断帕金森病，这种活检可以检测出帕金森病患者神经内的一种异常蛋白质。"皮肤检测基本上就是大脑的一扇窗"。
item.description:
Parkinson’s disease can now be diagnosed with a skin biopsy that can detect an abnormal protein people with Parkinson’s have inside their nerves.

“The skin test basically is a window into the brain." https://t.co/FYY0kzDShw https://t.co/FYY0kzDShw

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 21, 2024
